Posts.Content: hello,  I know, work should be the last thing I should be worried about. I am 32, I have been diagnosed with breast cancer and I will be undergoing chemo soon. I am worried how to approach work about the possibility of going part time. I work in a dental lab and I think its just too dangerous to be in there when my immune system is at its lowest. I also get the impression they're comparing me to a family member of theirs who still manged to work while having treatment (in a completely different job). I don't want them to make my life harder. can I get someone professional to speak on behalf of me? will I be punished later if I want to go full time?  my work offers no benefits of help, I have been told I will get ssp and I have to use my holidays to cover my hospital appointments.  any advice on how I can approach this. thank you
